items.sentence: Tom looked under the bed to see if the other slipper was there.
Tom wants me to throw him a birthday party next Monday evening.
Tom was about to say something, but Mary started talking first.
Tom woke the children up and told them to get ready for school.

Tom doesn\'t want me to talk about what we discussed yesterday.
Whether we go or not depends on whether or not Tom wants to go.
The doctor thought that the patient\'s pulse was a little fast.
I had no other way of contacting you, so I came here in person.
I can\'t deliver this until you tell me where to deliver it to.
Tom doesn\'t know whether to accept or to refuse Mary\'s offer.
Tom doesn\'t like to ask for help from people he doesn\'t know.
You can wait all afternoon if you like, but Tom won\'t see you.
Tom digitized an old family photo and emailed it to his mother.
Tom gave me the name of a guy who can probably repair my watch.
Tom has been drinking since 2:30 and is already a little drunk.
Tom spent the whole morning getting ready for his presentation.
I assume you only hire people who speak more than one language.
I doubt that Tom is even interested in trying to learn Russian.
Tom says he knows something about Mary that we don\'t know yet.
